title: There was a bench warrant for FTA and pay $7,500 order. Court records show the bench warrant was recalled. What can I do now?
question: I am still owed and don't know what the judge ordered as a penalty or ramification for the failure to pay the order now over one year old.
question_tags: Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Criminal defense,Victim compensation and criminal conviction,Criminal record,Warrants and criminal charges
answers:
why was a bench warrant issued? what does the case involve. do you have a hearing set in the case to return to court?

Please contact me with any questions.

Kevin Sullivan
415-441-1052

If you are talking about restitution, defendants are rarely penalized criminally for not paying restitution, unless they have a clear ability to pay and are flagrantly disregarding their duty to do so. In many cases, the restitution order becomes a civil judgment and is collectible in the same way sthat all civil debts are collectible.

You have not provided nearly enough information. What did you fail to appear for? Why were you ordered to pay $7500?

Keep in mind that the more details you provide about your situation, the more detailed the responses and advice provided will be.
